ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about how to analyze art and how to effectively enter an academic conversation.
argumentative writing skills, rhetorical analysis, how different academics and thinkers define beauty and the experience of witnessing beauty
Practice with academic research, writing, and group critique of writing. Ability to navigate the resources of the Yale University Art Gallery and the library systems.
I developed essential writing skills for both academic and contemplative essays.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
I enjoyed the readings for this course I felt they were relevant to the topic of beauty and came from a broad array of perspectives. I also enjoyed the free writes at the beginning of class and the opportunity to write creatively in the final assignment. Another strength of this class is that the professor was always willing to have individual meetings to discuss our work. 
One aspect of this class that I feel could be improved is knowing what is expected each week. Often the homework was posted on Friday or late in the weekend for a Monday class, which made it difficult for me to prepare sufficiently.

Strengths: good analysis of academic writing 
Weaknesses: sort of inconsistent in the idea of what was wanted from us in our writing, it felt like the standards were somewhat all over the place and the essay prompts were open-ended, which was hard because it was hard to know what to strive for in our essays. 
A lot of small articles were read for homework which didn't allow there to feel like there was a strong thematic throughline to the course and the class was small which meant that the same person always dominated the conversation every single class, more of an effort to diversify the kinds/formats of discussion would have been helpful

Strengths: feedback is clear and concise.

Weaknesses: Some readings were not associated to beauty at all and the homework assignments were posted way too late.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student because I felt that the professor was understanding and the topic was relevant to many social issues.
Yes. One of the more intriguing and rewarding classes I have taken here.

yes! professor jones is very helpful and a wonderful instructor. she's very flexible with meetings and is always willing to help. the material was interesting and didn't assume any prior knowledge in beauty/art, which was great as someone who isn't very artistic or knowledgeable in art history. the readings were diverse and changed the way i view beauty in media and advertising.
I would recommend English 114 as a category, I think the resources and practice it gave me good practice in the resources of Yale as a first year, but I would not recommend this course specifically
If you are interested in the philosophical notion of beauty and need a writing credit, you should take it. If you are interested in other topics, you should take another writing seminar.
